alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 11:55PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN FAYETTE AND SOUTHWESTERN PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1154 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located near Washington Court House, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Bloomingburg, New Holland, Milledgeville, Deer Creek Lake, Madison Mills, State Route 207 at US Route 22 and Pancoastburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
